newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates dive in liquid market.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates dive in liquid market.

text.p: Pakistan's money market rates dived and closed at 2.00 percent on Saturday owing to excess liquidity, compared to Friday's closing at 10 percent, dealers said.
The market started on a liquid note with bids and offers at 6.00 percent and 14 percent respectively but borrowers managed to bring the rates down to 7.00 percent, a dealer at KASB & Co said.
The rates closed at 2.00 percent and the market squared itself, he said.
